page.title: 18Sand and gravel excavation
page.content: A compromise solution was finally voted through by the County Council that ensured that any further excavation would be carried out in such a way that it caused minimum inconvenience to the community. The company was compelled by the Council to carry out such procedures as tree planting,water table maintenance and noise and dirt control. The action committee as such,is in abeyance,and the residents of Cossington have now formed a Parish Society with a much wider brief as a conservation group affiliated to the Civic Trust, but a Liaison Group,comprising the Charnwood Planing Officer and members the Parish Council,the Parish Society and the excavating company,continues to meet to moniter progress. by Mrs A.Smith Cont from p.17,now go to p.19.
